frontMatter.title: Know how their information is updated
frontMatter.description: This deprecated pattern guided design teams in helping users understand when and how their personal information will be updated.
frontMatter.intro: This pattern guided design teams in helping users understand when and how their personal information will be updated in their profile when modifying information within an application.

when_to_use.value: **Prefilled profile data.** When prefilled profile data is displayed and editable.
**Stored user data.** When forms show stored user data that may change based on form input.
**Profile update clarity.** When users need clarity about whether edits will update their VA.gov profile.

design_principles.value: **System status visibility.** Communicate current state so users feel in control.
**User autonomy.** Give users control over their own information management.

when_not_to_use.value: **Application-only updates.** If changes only apply to the current application, use instead: 'Any updates you make here to your [type of contact information] will only apply to this application.'
**Unreliable data modification.** Use caution with data that cannot be reliably modified.

examples.title: Display information on file
examples.description: Shows users what data is stored, noting if it cannot be changed in the current application.

examples.title: Editable information
examples.description: Profile data with edit links, introduction explaining usage, and note confirming profile updates.

examples.title: Edit workflow
examples.description: Users edit information, save changes to profile, and see updated information reflected immediately.

how_to_build.intro: The pattern demonstrates system status visibility and user autonomy principles.

accessibility.value: Edit links must be clearly labeled for screen readers.
Status changes should be announced to assistive technology.
